text.0: whenmen bṛhaspati giving names to objects sent out vāks first and earliest utterances.
text.1: all that was excellent and spotless treasured within them was disclosed through their affection.
text.2: where like men cleansing cornflour in a cribble the wise in spirit have created language.
text.3: friends see and recognize the marks of friendship their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted.
text.4: with sacrifice the trace of vāk they foilowed and found her harbouring within the Ṛṣis.
text.5: they brought her dealt her forth in many places seven singers make her tones resound in concert.
text.6: one man hath neer seen vāk and yet he seeth one man hath hearing but hath never heard her.
text.7: but to another hath she shown her beauty as a fond welldressed woman to her husband.
text.8: one man they call a laggard dull in friendship they never urge him on to deeds of valour.
text.9: he wanders on in profitless illusion the voice he heard yields neither fruitnor blossom.
text.10: no part in vāk hath he who hath abandoned his own dear friend who knows the truth of friendship.
text.11: even if he hears her still in vain he listens naught knows he of the path of righteous action.
text.12: unequal in the quickness of their spirit are friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing.
text.13: some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder others like pools of water fit to bathe in.
text.14: when friendly brahmans sacrifice together with mental impulse which the heart hath fashioned.
text.15: they leave one far behind through their attainments and some who count as brahmans wander elsewhere.
text.16: those men who step not back and move not forward nor brahmans nor preparers of libations.
text.17: having attained to vāk in sinful fashion spin out their thread in ignorance like spinsters.
text.18: all friends are joyful in the friend who cometh in triumph having conquered in assembly.
text.19: he is their blameaverter foodprovider prepared is he and fit for deed of vigour.
text.20: one plies his constant task reciting verses one sings the holy psalm in sakvari measures.
text.21: one more the brahman tells the lore of being and one lays down the rules of sacrificing.
